title: Man, 56, is impaled on a garden stake after falling from the roof of his home
text:
A man who was impaled on a garden stake after he fell off a roof in the NSW Hunter region has been flown to hospital with the stake still lodged in his body.

The stake pierced the 56-year-old man's underarm and went through his chest when he fell from the roof of a Lochinvar property on Monday morning, emergency services say.

The man was flown to John Hunter Hospital in a stable condition with the stake still in his body.

Westpac Rescue Helicopter spokesman Graham Nickisson told AAP the man was able to speak with the medical crew which attended the scene about 10am.

The man remains in a stable condition following treatment, a hospital spokesman said.
description: A man who was impaled on a garden stake after he fell off a roof in the NSW Hunter region has been flown to hospital with the stake still lodged in his body.
